title: How to Draw Simple Comic Characters

steps.headline: Sketch a circle for the head.
Then, draw an oblong attached to it.
Sketch a vertical oblong for the body.
Sketch the extremities and the neck as lines showing the cartoon character’s position.
Sketch 4 lines in the face as guidelines for the eyes, nose, and mouth.
Draw the eyes, mouth, and ears.
steps.description: Experiment on the expressions shown through these facial parts.

steps.headline: Draw the hair as you like.
steps.description: You can also experiment on this.

steps.headline: Then draw the body and the clothes that you like the character to have.

text: Sketch a circle for the head.  Then, draw an oblong attached to it.  Sketch a vertical oblong for the body.  Sketch the extremities and the neck as lines showing the cartoon character’s position.  Sketch 4 lines in the face as guidelines for the eyes, nose, and mouth.  Draw the cheeks.  Draw the eyes, mouth, and ears. Experiment on the expressions shown through these facial parts. Draw the hair as you like. You can also experiment on this. Then draw the body and the clothes that you like the character to have.  Erase the draft lines.  Color.
sentences: Sketch a circle for the head.
Then, draw an oblong attached to it.
Sketch a vertical oblong for the body.
Sketch the extremities and the neck as lines showing the cartoon character’s position.
Sketch 4 lines in the face as guidelines for the eyes, nose, and mouth.
Draw the eyes, mouth, and ears.
Experiment on the expressions shown through these facial parts.
Draw the hair as you like.
You can also experiment on this.
Then draw the body and the clothes that you like the character to have.
